intro: Peperidia afzeliana, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features strap-like, grassy leaves that form a rosette at the base. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Peperidia afzeliana is also valued for its resilience and ability to attract pollinators.
